intro: Senecio radiolatus, commonly known as the radiate senecio, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a perennial herb with a rosette of gray-green, woolly leaves that help reduce water loss in arid environments. The plant produces showy yellow flowers arranged in a radiate pattern, typical of the Asteraceae family. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Due to its ornamental value and drought tolerance, it is often cultivated in gardens across regions with Mediterranean climates.
